item.title: Understanding HTML templates in Go (golang)
item.description: I use Echo in this post, but you could also use plain net/http, or any of the other awesome web frameworks for Go, see a list here. The Go standard library provides a html/template package, for dynamically rendering HTML, it is built on top of text/template Go templates are normal HTML files, with “Actions” (data evaluations or control structures), these “Actions” are delimited via {{and}}. A template is executed via applying a data structure to it, the data structure is referenced as a dot .

item.title: Inner workings of allocating slices with Go (golang)
item.description: I wasn’t sure what the performance impact of preallocating a slice with make vs. just letting the slice grow via append is, so I investigated a little. Arrays In order to understand what a slice is one needs to first understand how arrays work in go. An array’s type definition specifies a length and an element type.
